titleStmt.title: SII 12.169: original edition by V. Venkatasubba Ayyar
No. 169. (A.R. No. 450 of 1919). ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE SAME ‘ROCK’.

summary.p: This epigraph dated in the same year, registers a gift of a lamp-stand and cows for burning a perpetual lamp before the god Aruḷāḷap-Perumāḷ, ‘who was pleased to stand at Tiruvattiyūr in Kāñchīpuram’ in Eyiṟ-kōṭṭam, a district of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻamaṇḍalam, by Nārāyaṇaṉ Śaṁkaraṉ of Koḍumuṇḍai, a nāyaka of Malai-maṇḍalam. Malai-maṇḍalam is the Chēra country on the west coast and the people of this tract are frequently met with in inscriptions found outside their territory. They figure mostly as traders in which capacity they seem to have gone far into the interior of South India.
The astronomical citations in the record are regular for A.D. 1254, July 20, Monday.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . sa kalapuvaṉaccakkaravattikaḷ śrīkopperuñciṅkatevaṟku yāṇṭu 10 1vatu kaṟkaṭaka nāyaṟṟu pūrvapakṣa ttup pañcamiyum tiṅkaṭkiḻamaiyumāṉa Uttirattunāḷ
jayaṅkoṇṭacoḻamaṇṭalattu Eyiṟkoṭṭattuk kāñcipurattut tiruvattiyūrniṉṟaruḷiya Aru ḷāḷapperumāḷukku malaimaṇṭalattu nāyakkaṉmāril
koṭumuṇṭai nārāyaṇaṉ [śaṅ karaṉ] Engraved below the line. vaitta tirunaṉtāviḷakku Oṉṟukku viṭṭa pāṟpacu 10m ciṉaippacu 10m polimuṟaināku 10 2m Iṣapam 1m Āka Uru muppattumuṉṟum
tirunantāviḷakkukkuṭi maṇavāḷatātaṉum viṟṟiruntāṉum kaikkoṇṭu nāḷ Oṉṟukku Aḷakkum Arumoḻinaṅkai nāḻiyāl ney Uḻakkum tayiramutu nāḻiyum
candrāditya varai celuttakkaṭavarkaḷākac cilālekai paṇṇikkuṭuttom perumāḷ koyilt tāṉattom . Ittiruviḷakku Eṟṟa vaitta tirukkuttuviḷakku Oṉṟu . Ivai koyiṟ kaṇakkuc ciyapuramuṭaiyāṉ Eḻuttu .
Digital edition of SII 12.169 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
